intro: Acrostichum alpestre, commonly known as the alpine fern, is a species of fern native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to rocky substrates. Acrostichum alpestre plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and supports local biodiversity.
